intro: Myrrhinium octandrum, commonly known as the eight-stamen grass, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-brown flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of grass family members. Myrrhinium octandrum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and traditional herbal practices.
